ray.rage.rendersystem.states

Interface TextureState

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable, RenderState
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GL4TextureState

    public interface TextureState
extends RenderState
    A texture state determines which textures will be used, how they'll be applied, filtered, stored in GPU memory, and other properties.

    Texture states are decoupled from textures because, in this way, the same state can be applied to multiple textures at once without duplication.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  TextureState.ColorComponents
      The color components specify which basic colors are represented and whether alpha transparency is included.
      static class  TextureState.MagnificationFilter
      A magnification filter is a texture filtering function, used whenever the pixel being textured maps to an area less than or equal to that of one texel.
      static class  TextureState.MemoryFormat
      The memory format describes the space storage requirement for each data "value".
      static class  TextureState.MinificationFilter
      A minification filter is a texture filtering function.
      static class  TextureState.PixelFormat
      The pixel format is describes the internal image data available for each pixel.
      static class  TextureState.Target
      A texture target is specifies the type of textures that are supported.
      static class  TextureState.WrapMode
      The wrap mode is a function that determines how texture coordinates will be used to map texels to pixels.

    • Method Detail

      • setTexture

        void setTexture(Texture t)
        Sets the texture to be used when applying this state.

        By default, it gets assigned to texture unit zero.

        Parameters:
        t - The texture.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the texture is null.

      • setTexture

        void setTexture(Texture t,
                int textureUnit)
        Sets the texture to be used when applying this state.
        Parameters:
        t - The texture.
        textureUnit - The unit where the texture will go.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the texture is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the unit is negative or greater than the number of available units, which is hardware-dependent.

      • getTexture

        Texture getTexture()
        Gets the texture at unit zero.
        Returns:
        The texture in unit zero, if one exists. Otherwise null.

      • getTexture

        Texture getTexture(int textureUnit)
        Gets the texture at specified unit.
        Parameters:
        textureUnit - The unit from which to get the texture.
        Returns:
        The texture in the specified unit, if one exists.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the unit is negative or greater than the number of available units, which is hardware-dependent.
